glsa.title: OpenOffice.org: Temporary files disclosure
glsa.synopsis: OpenOffice.org uses insecure temporary files which could allow a malicious local user to gain knowledge of sensitive information from other users' documents.

background.p: OpenOffice.org is an office productivity suite, including word processing, spreadsheets, presentations, drawings, data charting, formula editing, and file conversion facilities.

description.p: On start-up, OpenOffice.org 1.1.2 creates a temporary directory with insecure permissions. When a document is saved, a compressed copy of it can be found in that directory.

impact.p: A malicious local user could obtain the temporary files and thus read documents belonging to other users.

workaround.p: There is no known workaround at this time.
